TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class DataColumnMapping : MarshalByRefObject, ICloneable, System.Data.IColumnMapping
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataColumnMapping extends System.MarshalByRefObject implements class System.Data.IColumnMapping, class System.ICloneable

Docs.summary: Contains a generic column mapping for an object that inherits from <see cref="T:System.Data.Common.DataAdapter">. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A DataColumnMapping enables you to use column names in a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> that are different from those in the data source. The `DataAdapter` uses the mapping to match the columns when the tables in the <xref:System.Data.DataSet> or data source are updated. For more information, see [DataAdapter DataTable and DataColumn Mappings](../Topic/DataAdapter%20DataTable%20and%20DataColumn%20Mappings.md).
## Examples The following example creates a DataColumnMapping object and adds it to a <xref:System.Data.Common.DataColumnMappingCollection>. It then tells the user that the mapping was added to the collection and shows the Parent for the mapping.
[!CODE [Classic WebData DataColumnMapping Example#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataColumnMapping Example#1)]

Docs.param: The case-sensitive column name from a data source.
The column name, which is not case sensitive, from a <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> to map to.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping"> class with the specified source column name and <xref:System.Data.DataSet> column name to map to.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the column within the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> to map to.
Docs.value: The name of the column within the <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> to map to. The name is not case sensitive.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Data.DataColumn GetDataColumnBySchemaAction (System.Data.DataTable dataTable, Type dataType, System.Data.MissingSchemaAction schemaAction);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.DataColumn GetDataColumnBySchemaAction(class System.Data.DataTable dataTable, class System.Type dataType, valuetype System.Data.MissingSchemaAction schemaAction) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Data.DataTable"> to get the column from.
The <see cref="T:System.Type"> of the data column.
Docs.summary: Gets a <see cref="T:System.Data.DataColumn"> from the given <xref:System.Data.DataTable> using the <xref:System.Data.MissingSchemaAction> and the <xref:System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping.DataSetColumn%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Data.DataColumn GetDataColumnBySchemaAction (string sourceColumn, string dataSetColumn, System.Data.DataTable dataTable, Type dataType, System.Data.MissingSchemaAction schemaAction);

.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.DataColumn GetDataColumnBySchemaAction(string sourceColumn, string dataSetColumn, class System.Data.DataTable dataTable, class System.Type dataType, valuetype System.Data.MissingSchemaAction schemaAction) cil managed

Docs.param: The case-sensitive column name from a data source.
The column name, which is not case sensitive, from a <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> to map to.
The data type for the column being mapped.
Determines the action to take when existing <see cref="T:System.Data.DataSet"> schema does not match incoming data.
Docs.summary: A static version of <xref:System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping.GetDataColumnBySchemaAction%2A> that can be called without instantiating a <xref:System.Data.Common.DataColumnMapping> object.
Gets or sets the name of the column within the data source to map from. The name is case-sensitive.
Docs.value: The case-sensitive name of the column in the data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ICloneable> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ICloneable.Clone%2A>.
